data.fullContent: Chris had never run a marathon before, and he didn't think he was in any shape to attempt one. But his best friend, who ran marathons himself, had been trying to get Chris to train for one for months. Chris didn't go for it at first, but when he realized how much his friend wanted him to train with him, he agreed. He started running slowly on a track in his town, with a mix of jogging and walking. Every week he tried to run a little further than the week before. Every day that he wasn't in school he spent running, sometimes three hours a day. The first few weeks were really hard, but eventually he grew fitter and fitter, and started to get excited. He knew he was going to finish the marathon, and it seemed so far off it was almost unreal.

q1.translation: 克里斯以前从未跑过马拉松，他认为自己的身体状况不适合尝试。但他最好的朋友，自己也跑马拉松，几个月来一直想让克里斯参加马拉松训练。克里斯一开始并没有同意，但当他意识到他的朋友非常想和他一起训练时，他同意了。他开始在镇上的一条跑道上慢慢地跑步，混合着慢跑和散步。
q1.front: Chris had never run a marathon before, and he didn't think he was in any shape to attempt one. But his best friend, who ran marathons himself, had been trying to get Chris to train for one for months. Chris didn't go for it at first, but when he realized how much his friend wanted him to train with him, he agreed. He started running slowly on a track in his town, with a mix of jogging and walking.
q1.content: Chris had never run a marathon ____, and he didn't think he was in any shape to attempt one. But his best ____, who ran marathons himself, had been ____ to get Chris to train for one ____ months. Chris didn't ____ for it at first, but when he realized how much his friend wanted him to train with him, ____ agreed. He started running slowly on a track in his town, with a mix of jogging and walking.

q2.translation: 克里斯以前从未跑过马拉松，他认为自己的身体状况不适合尝试。但他最好的朋友，自己也跑马拉松，几个月来一直想让克里斯参加马拉松训练。克里斯一开始并没有同意，但当他意识到他的朋友非常想和他一起训练时，他同意了。他开始在镇上的一条跑道上慢慢地跑步，混合着慢跑和散步。每周他都试着比上一周跑得更远一点。不上学的每一天，他都在跑步，有时一天跑三个小时。最初的几周真的很艰难，但最终他变得越来越健康，开始变得兴奋起来。他知道自己会跑完马拉松，但这似乎是如此遥远，几乎是不真实的。

Chris didn't go for it at first, but when he realized how much his friend wanted him to train with him, he agreed. He started running slowly on a track in his town, with a mix of jogging and walking.

Chris was out running when the kids in the park noticed him.
Chris needs to train harder, or he won't make the team.
After a few months, Chris decided to try out for the football team.

q3.selectAnswer: he realized how much his friend wanted him to train with him

options.sentence: Chris had never run a marathon before, but his friend had been trying to get him to train for one.
Chris decided on the marathon to experience something new and take on a challenge.
Chris liked the idea of doing a fall race and chose the fall race because it was less expensive than spring races.
Chris decided not to run in the race because he was worried he had been pushing himself too hard.
